page.title: 18LANDSCAPE
page.content: {RIVERS:-}The main river is AVON WATER. This river runs in a north easterly direction starting south west of Strathaven and passing to the east at a distance of about 1km.The name Strathaven literally means the valley of the Avon.The Powmillon Burn flows through Strathaven crossing John Hastie Park and running parallel to Waterside Street,it goes on to join the Avon east of the town. {RELIEF:-}Strathaven is over 180 metres above sea level-one of the highest villages in Scotland. {SETTLEMENTS:-}apart from the town itself the only settlement in our area is the small hamlet of Sandford to the south east.There are however a substantial number of farms and houses in the countryside around the town. {VEGETATION:-}Little in the way of forest,mostly arable and grazing.
